nodes.text: Master Hyor-ka's dao-ben steamed bun shop

Master Hyor-ka's dao-ben steamed bun shop was a business owned by Master Hyor-ka by the the time of the rebellion on Akiva. The establishment was located in the Outer Rim planet Akiva's capital city of Myrra, one alley away from the junk dealer Temmin Wexley's spare parts shop. Under Hyor-ka's ownership, the shop sold dao-ben steamed buns, a type of bread. The shop had a tarp covering part of its roof, and an awning topping its entryway.

In 4 ABY, Wexley hid on the roof of Master Hyor-ka's dao-ben steamed bun shop, under a tarp, while spying on thugs working for the crime lord Surat Nuat. The thugs spotted Wexley and attacked him, forcing the junk dealer out of his hiding spot and off the roof. Wexley hit the shop's awning as gravity propelled him down into the street below.
Master Hyor-ka's dao-ben steamed bun shop first appeared in Aftermath, a 2015 novel written by Chuck Wendig.
